page.title: 18Elderly Farndon residents
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Hyde have been telling us about Farndon. Mr. Hyde was born in Farndon 68 years ago. The house he lived in is still there. Mrs. Hyde is 62 and she used to live in Alpine Lodge. It was the last house in Marsh Lane; all the rest was taken up by fields. There was no recreation ground then and there used to be a football pitch where the pits are now. They took gravel from the pits to make runways. Four of Mr. Hyde's brothers sang in the choir, 2 in the men's and 2 in the boy's. In the school there were 3 classes. The toilets were outside and they had no wash basins. They had saved up to ave their playground tarmaced and it cost only twelve old pence!
